title: Pre-Job Briefing Essentials
content: Effective briefings establish shared understanding before work begins. Cover scope, hazards, roles, communication protocols, contingencies, and stop-work authority. Invite questions. A briefing where no one speaks isn't effective—it's a monologue that may not have landed.

mcq.question: You finish a pre-job briefing and ask 'Any questions?' Silence. What should you conclude?

options.C: They'll ask if something comes up

mcq.explanation: Silence often indicates disengagement, fear of asking, or assumption without understanding. Ask specific questions to test comprehension. 'What's our response if X happens?' reveals actual understanding.

openQuestions: How do you verify understanding beyond asking for questions?
What elements do your briefings consistently cover or miss?
